data.title: The Best Dining Spot In Town
data.text: I Love this spot very cozy!!! Excellent location downtown Longview, Tx Great food and drinks!!Check it out

data.title: Good Lunch
data.text: Love the two bento box lunch specials. Also several  delicious fresh sushi choices. Yumm  Will come back for very affordable meal

data.title: Sushi in Longview
data.text: Very pleasantly surprised how good the sushi was at Osaka considering we were in Longview Texas. Nice resturant downtown.

data.title: Yessssss
data.text: I love it. It is so so so good. I can't wait to go eat there every chance I get. You can visit and eat good food

data.title: Birthday Dinner
data.text: We came here to celebrate my nephews bday .  The food was superb and they were super nice.  The restaurant is in the business courthouse area, which is not my normal path... But I've come several times... Never left disappointed!

data.title: Never disappointed!!!
data.text: We've been here several times in the past few years and are always amazed how good it is.  The Rainbow and Texas rolls are a personal favorite.

data.title: always good
data.text: I love this place because it always has different kinds of sake the food is always always good never had a bad meal there yet always there for lunch great atmosphere

data.title: Love it
data.text: My wife and I have a eaten there many times.   They have a large selection on their menu all is reasonably priced.   Each time they're mostly adults there but it is family-friendly.  It has great atmosphere and the staff is very friendly.   I would highly recommend the shrimp tempura.

data.title: Great downtown Longview!
data.text: Good consistent Asian food. Good for lunch or dinner. Kinda plain décor. But not dirty. Many different options on the menu. Not open for breakfast. No meeting, party room. Excellent house Asian salad dressing. Food is always fresh with fresh ingredients. For good Asian food in downtown Longview, you cant go wrong here.

data.title: Ashley Rocks!
data.text: We visited this restaurant as a last resort because we couldn't get in at the other local Japanese restaurants because of the long wait time on a Saturday night. Big Mistake! This should've been our first choice and definitely will be going forward. The best place to go if you've been to a thousand hibachi restaurants and don't care to see another demonstration of the "egg roll" or the "volcano" made of onion and soy sauce. The best fried rice you're going to get in Longview. And the salad dressing... Yummy!!! And to top it off, Ashley was wonderful and so accommodating. We will certainly be back! I couldn't give this place a 5 because there was a little bit of a weird smell in the building...maybe because it's in the older downtown area.

data.title: Hibachi was killer!
data.text: Hubby and I had the filet and shrimp hibachi for 2 (they were running a special on it for $45). Filet ordered med-rare and cooked to perfection as well as shrimp! Dipping sauce was savory, fried rice and veggies had a great flavor as well. Even the salad was great; cold, crisp and the dressing was excellent! I loved the atmosphere too. It was a cute little place with high ceilings and brick walls. Hubby and I were blown away!

data.title: Awesome sushi!
data.text: Service was exceptional...seaweed salad was awesome...you have to try to Texas roll...while u r in tx! Very cool atmosphere...

data.title: Best Sushi in Town!
data.text: The Longview Roll is fabulous! Staff is always nice, love coming downtown and getting out of the hustle and bustle of everything. It is a little pricy as we can easily drop $80 on a dinner for 2. Highly recommend for a nice evening out though.

data.title: Good place for break from the ordinary
data.text:
Great Sushi and other Japanese entrees. If you need a break from the usual burgers and barbeque, this is the place to go.
Good service.

data.title: Nice place!
data.text: At first glance,it seems that Osaka is more expensive than the other Japanese places in town. However, the other places charge quite a bit extra for fried rice, which is included in the meal here. There is no "show" like some places, but I think the food quality is much better. The chicken is my favorite. My daughter and her husband love the sushi. They have a variety of offerings for sushi here. The salad dressing is yummy.

data.title: Sushi...
data.text: Who doesn't love good sushi? This place is our favorite place to get sushi. Always fresh and taste very good.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Food was good. Maybe a little pricey, but quality food. The kitchen had run out of the sushi my friend wanted, but we still had a very enjoyable dinner.

data.title: Good sushi but weird entree
data.text: Sushi was very nice, could have even ordered more but the entree was a weird combination. Had Teriyaki chicken, too many pineapples and some weird grilled veggies what I would expect in a Italian restaurant but not at a Japanese. Fried rice was OK. Overall the sushi is yummy! Maybe next time only sushi!

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Very nice atmosphere downtown. The food was very good. The Steak, Chicken and Shrimp with rice was good. The down side  they don't serve noodles...but the food was still good.

data.title: Trying to hard
data.text: This restaurant is trying to hard to be East Texas sushi/ asian/ fusion/ and way too many other things. I think a Japanese restaurant with a name like Osaka should specialize in in Japanese food only.
